review_blob: Very delightful.  Ruby bubbly appearance, with blackcurrant notes.  A charming beer.
beer_name: Samuel Adams Imperial Series Imperial White

review_blob: Delicious, White Dog, UPenn.  Good standard session beer.  Decent color, good stuff over lunch.
Green Rock Tavern, Fishtown.  On the sweet side, to be certain, nice froth.  Great style with the pencil on the beer tap paddle.
UPDATED: SEP 27, 2010

Its alright, but without the body of a real beer to broadcast the lime flavor.  Comes off a little like a limeade, and a weak one at that.  But its a nice concept.  Btw, what the hell is Chelada style?

A little super pungent at first, but then I start to really, really like it as I go down the bottle.  Tastes like nature, the nature the bottle alludes to.  I do want to know more about this "two hearted" concept... related to fishing?
Its okay, floral and a little sweet, but not groundbreaking, unfortunately.  No Celebration for hops.

An opaque ebony-amber.  A sip, a flush of memories over my mind, as I remember what it was like in my beer aficionado days of two years ago.  All those memories of travelling cities, tasting the malts... this beer did for me what fine food and drink is supposed to do -- complement new experiences, and remind you gregariously of the old.

beer_brewer_name: Schneider Weisse G. Schneider & Sohn GmbH
review_blob: An interesting concept, and a heavy, wonderful aroma coming off of this.  However, I dont think I would buy it again.  Theres severe complexity going on here, and it just seemed a bit too much.  A good beer -- and damnit I do love those beers from Brooklyn -- but maybe best paired with a meal to bring out the full flavor.  Otherwise, it didnt inspire me to finish the glass.

beer_brewer_name: Magic Hat Brewing Company (North American Breweries)
review_blob: Pretty well done.  Polished flavor for a hefe.  Someone had randomly brought this out to a party.

beer_brewer_name: Old Dominion Brewing Company (Coastal Brewing Co.)
review_blob: Bigger fan of the lager.  On tap, and too bitter.  Yes, I know... but still... too bitter.
Milder on the hops than its regular red hook bretheren.  Its an OK overall balance.

beer_brewer_name: Leinenkugel Brewing Company (Tenth & Blake Beer Co.)
review_blob: Too sweet for me.  Malty.  Has a passionate following from the Midwest crew, though.

beer_brewer_name: Magic Hat Brewing Company (North American Breweries)
review_blob: Premier deliousness.  Hoplastic.  Great inspiring messages on the bottom of the bottlecaps too.  Great stuff for winter.
Fairly alright, but not really that warming for a winter beer.  A selection with hops might have been a lot better.
Not bad, rounded flavor for a Pils.  Gets one thumb up.  Session-y.
Compendium of taste.                                                                  Andys, Bogota.
Crazy, lovely taste.  Doesnt taste like an oyster at all.  Wait a minute...
Sweet!  Round tasting, good stuff.  Im a fan.  Not as peachy as the label would suggest.
Kinda syrupy, eh.  Glad this was a sample generously given me by a stellar bartendress.

beer_brewer_name: Old Dominion Brewing Company (Coastal Brewing Co.)
review_blob: Delicious!  On tap at Falls Church, VA.  Malty, sweet, caramelly and bold.  Slidey slides down your throat, prepping you for a cheerful new year.

beer_brewer_name: ChopHouse & Brewery D.C. (owned by Rock Bottom)
review_blob: I believe the same thing as the HopTastic or HopPocket or HopPalicious or whatever it was they were selling as the chalkboard pale ale.  Slightly spicy, light light brown.  (Caveat:  this may be a different beer.)
One of the Kolschiest Kolsches Ive had in the USA.  But it doesnt mean its perfect.  More metal than needed in the flavor, the Kolsch needs to make your tounge feel like it just took flight.
Mellow, kind to you.  Good stuff for session, but lacking in much flavor.
Definitely red.  Its an alright, subtley hoppy blend of something or other.
Nice flavor, mellow grassy taste.  Big fan of this.  Washington, DC location.  One of the best places to have a beer and casual early evening conversation in DC.
Jumpy on the tounge, strangely okay.  Avoids the stick-candy taste of a lot of these Oktoberfests.
It was alright... fairly standard but unoffensive.  Great for the bitter style though.
Nice taste, but a bit unrefined.  This one has to decide whether its going to be a classy beer or a rugged standard one.
Delicious, with the sweetness consistency a bit like that of maple syrup or something.  Delicious, grainy and robust.
Very hoppy, bouncy.  Good to go, but lemony bitter aftertaste a bit unpleasant.  Had this while watching trivia at a New Haven bar.  Whee!

The order of the day.  Rich and hearty, chocolate and espresso notes all over the place, like Bakers chocolate smashed up and blended with your local espresso joint and a kiss of cherry snuck in.  Yeah, something like that.  Real espresso felt all over this beer.  Even on a hot day this was excellent.  Good work.  This could be a dessert beer, or an afternoon standover break from travelling across Long Island earlier in the hot summer day.
This summer ale did not speak to me as a summer muse.  More like a bored whisper lingering in the corner of a stuffy room waiting for summer to pass into the glory of September.
Nothing out of the ordinary here.  A standard IPA without many hops, surprisingly for a brewpub.
Yeah, its a good beer, and nice because it was made as an anniversary celebration (10 years for SPH, I think?).  Good rounded and robust overtones.  Not Old Peculier, but nice all the same.  Frothy.

Spunkier than I expected, Ill give it that.  The people around us seemed to love this beer, though I wasnt whisked away into a field of raspberry glory.  A little bitter, like raspberry seeds.  Good though.  Probably would not order a pint of this.
Very delicious.  Grassy and clover notes, subtle hops, good show, good show.  This is an excellent session beer that can be paired all over the menu.
Decent, nothing stellar.  Holds its own as a mandatory offer for the light beer set.
Really suprisingly good for a super light beer.  Just the right taste of caramel overtones, etc.  Great easy drinking beer for summer.
A bit spicy and hoppy for my taste for a porter.  But decent.  Goes to thine head.
Obviously darker, a little less taste than the light, but more heft.  Frothy brown head.  Lots of it actually.
Applely overtures in taste.  Can I use a word like overture in McSorelys?  Sure I can.  On draft.  Delicious beer you can bite.

Had this at beautiful DC location.  Called the seasonal Sommerfest, sneaking suspicion its this beer (it was described as a Kolsch, and even served ina  proper Kolsch glass!).  Good golden body, bright bouncy notes.  Still a tad heavy on the palate.  Great nonetheless.

On tap at Dr. Dremos.  Seriously tasted like a rich Entemanns chocolate donut, in liquid form.  Not the best beer to end the night, itll knock you over.  Taste-buds wise, not really alcohol wise.  Good stuff though.  Beach bar at Dr. Dremos... first time out there, after movies (Clerks II) with Leah.
Mm, delicious, creamy tasting, and sweet.  Straight from the flagon, via a glass.  Shared this with Ed Hardy whilst he was house-sitting in NW.
Somewhat spicy, wafty on the nostrils.  Hefty in appearance.  One will probably do for this beer.
Finally had the lovely NattyBo, from the Land of Pleasant Living.  Lived pleasantly while watching Cubs-Mets, eating homemade chili, and drinking this with friends at the DC house.
Mendocino Restaurant, Georgetown.  A relationship?  Probably not.  Full tasting, but not really the best for the amber style.
Its alright, definitely bready harsh notes.  Bottle, bought in DC.  Not much else to say, un-outstanding.

Hawk n Dove, the District of Columbia.  Two promotional girls in Heineken Light t-shirts tied up were offering this.  Its alright, crisp and all that, but not overpoweringly good.  Id recommend it for a light beer, though it has crazy ass grassy notes to the flavor.
